input.label: Inspection ID
input.hint: This is a unique inspection ID for every inspection performed.

input.label: Facility ID
input.hint: This is a unique facility ID that links the inspection back to the SWMFAC table.

input.label: Date
input.hint: The date the inspection was performed. When an inspection is entered using the field editing application, the inspection date will auto populate into the BMP_Inspection table.

input.label: Inspector
input.hint: First initial and last name (no space) of the members of the inspection team.

select1.label: Field Matches Plan
select1.hint: BMP as observed in the field matches the set of plans being reviewed.

select1.label: Context
select1.hint: The exposure of the BMP to surrounding land uses.

select1.label: Occupation Hazard
select1.hint: An occupational hazard exists that future inspectors or maintenance individuals should be aware of.

select1.label: Debris
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the BMP related to the physical presence of unwanted woody / leafy material, garbage accumulations, and sedimentation that possibly can block the outlet structure.

select1.label: Inflow Condition
select1.hint: Scores the overall impact of the discharges into a BMP and their adverse effects that may impair the performance of the BMP.

select1.label: Inflow Stability
select1.hint: Scores the condition of flows into a BMP such as areas of sheet flow, swales, and storm drains discharging into the BMP.

select1.label: BMP Contamination
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the BMP related to residue of contaminants from nearby activities or non-point source pollution within the watershed.

select1.label: Ponding
select1.hint: Scores the accumulation of stormwater beyond 72 hours after a storm event resulting in loss of storage for water quality and / or detention.

input.label: Water Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Measurement of the depth of the excessive ponded water in the facility.

select1.label: Pre-Treatment
select1.hint: Scores the BMP feature(s) relating to pretreatment of stormwater (via swales, filters, etc.) prior to entering the treatment area.

select1.label: Mowability
select1.hint: Scores the areas requiring routine mowing and slope considerations for allowing the mowing function to take place.

select1.label: BMP Access
select1.hint: Scores the existence of a maintenance access road and, if it exists, how well is it designed to meet SHA criteria.

input.label: Access Comment
input.hint: Describes issues relating to accessing a BMP site for field inspection or remedial actions.

select1.label: Conveyance Stability
select1.hint: Scores the stability of flow conveyance through the stormwater treatment area.

select1.label: Downstream Condition
select1.hint: Scores the overall downstream channel conditions beyond the SHA ROW.

select1.label: Emergency Spillway Stability
select1.hint: Scores the stability of the emergency spillway relating to erosion of sides and bottom.

select1.label: Emergency Spillway Opening
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the emergency spillway weir opening to function as designed when necessary.

select1.label: Orifice Opening
select1.hint: Scores the opening of the low-flow orifice to allow for proper drainage of the BMP.

select1.label: Orifice Trash Rack
select1.hint: Scores the structural condition of the trash rack on the low-flow orifice.

select1.label: Control Structure Opening
select1.hint: Scores the openings of the riser structure, weir, or end-section (also headwall) to allow for proper flow through the spillway.

select1.label: Control Structure Structure
select1.hint: Scores the overall structural integrity of the riser weir or outlet structure.

select1.label: Control Structure Sediment
select1.hint: Scores the amount of sediment accumulated inside the riser structure that could restrict the riser performance.

select1.label: Control Structure Trash Rack
select1.hint: Scores the structural condition of the trash rack on the riser structure.

select1.label: Control Structure Valve
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the valves and associated appurtenances of the riser.

select1.label: Principle Spillway
select1.hint: Scores the overall condition of the principle spillway (pipe / barrel).

select1.label: Spillway Outfall
select1.hint: Scores the condition of the outfall of the principle spillway and within 25 feet of the principal spillway structure.

select1.label: Public Hazard
select1.hint: Evaluates the evidence of trespassing, temporary habitation, or downstream occupancy.

select1.label: Potential for Public Hazard
select1.hint: Scores the <u>potential</u> for trespassing or temporary habitation based upon surrounding land uses.

select1.label: Fencing
select1.hint: Scores the fencing condition by considering placement and structural condition when fencing exists to secure the BMP (other than right-of-way fencing).

select1.label: Safe Water Depth
select1.hint: Scores the potential safety risk to the public due to deep water.

select1.label: Visibility
select1.hint: Scores the relative visibility of the facility from surrounding roadways, office complexes, shopping centers, residential areas, or other areas.

select1.label: rating
select1.hint: This rating is a qualitative evaluation of the individual parameters relating to environmental quality and sustainability to establish an overall rating value for the BMP facility.

input.label: Comment Response
input.hint: This section allows for a response to comments made during previous inspection cycles.

input.label: Overall Comments
input.hint: This section allows for any additional comments, such as specific site conditions, maintenance requests, and any other additional information associated with the BMP.

group.label: Underground Facility Pipe Storage Inspection Form

input.label: Upstream (U/S) Structure ID
input.hint: Unique SHA assigned number for the upstream structure.

input.label: Downstream (D/S) Structure ID
input.hint: Unique SHA assigned number for the downstream structure.

input.label: Surface Condition
input.hint: Comments on the ground surface condition above pipe and around u/s and d/s structures

input.label: Structure Access Condition
input.hint: Comments on the facility access, such as broken ladder rungs, rusted lid, or a broken rim

select1.label: Pipe Material
select1.hint: Observed material of pipe

input.label: Pipe Diameter (in.)
input.hint: Measured inner pipe diameter

input.label: Surveyed Length (ft.)
input.hint: Total length of inspected pipe

select1.label: Precleaned
select1.hint: Was this pipe cleaned prior to this inspection?

input.label: Estimated U/S Invert Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Depth from bottom of u/s structure to top of rim or top of structure

input.label: Estimated D/S Invert Depth (ft.)
input.hint: Depth from bottom of d/s structure to top of rim or top of structure

select1.label: Survey Direction
select1.hint: Direction that the underground survey follows

input.label: Phone number
input.hint: Phone number that the inspector can be reached at.

input.label: Start Time
input.hint: Time inspection started

input.label: End Time
input.hint: Time inspection ended

input.label: This issue tracker is for entering pipe issues as a function of the facility's length
Percent Pipe Blocked
input.hint: Enter an approximate %

input.label: Remark
input.hint: e.g. "Longitudinal crack at 0:12 sec, approx 8 inches long"

input.label: Instructions
input.hint: Check all that apply and circle a number of rating given. The worst defect along the individual storm drain length is used to give a signle condition grade for that particular pipe length. The grade is based on the highest (worst) internal condition grade along the pipe length.

item.label: Road severely sagging/caving due to settlement and or closed to traffic
Partial or complete collapse of pipe
Deformation >10% and pipe broken or fractured
Extensive areas of pipe material missing and/or extensive perforations in pipe
Partial or complete collapse of endwall/headwall structure with embankment failure encroaching on roadway shoulder
Embankment failure near pipe encroaching on roadway shoulder
Multiple sections are out of alignment; pipe is not functioning
